Class PokerServer

java.lang.Object
com.dnikitin.poker.server.PokerServer
public class PokerServer extends Object
The core TCP server implementation for the Poker game.

Concurrency Model: This server utilizes Java 21+ Virtual Threads (via Executors.newVirtualThreadPerTaskExecutor()). Unlike traditional thread pools, virtual threads are lightweight entities managed by the JVM, allowing the server to handle thousands of concurrent connections with a simple "thread-per-client" model. Even though the socket is configured in blocking mode, blocking operations (like I/O) unmount the virtual thread from the OS carrier thread, ensuring high throughput.

Responsibilities:

  • Accepting incoming TCP connections.
  • Managing the lifecycle of connection handlers.
  • Initializing security components (Rate Limiting, Timeouts).

  • Constructor Details

    • PokerServer

      public PokerServer(int port)
      Initializes the server configuration and security subsystems.
      Parameters:
      port - The port to bind to (e.g., 9999).

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the server loop.

      This method binds the server socket and enters a blocking loop that accepts incoming connections. For each connection, a new ClientHandler is instantiated and submitted to the virtual thread executor.

      Note: This method blocks the calling thread until stop() is called or a critical error occurs.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the server gracefully.

      Closes the server socket to stop accepting new connections, shuts down the executors, and cleans up resources. Active client handlers might be terminated abruptly if they do not exit within the timeout period.
